metadata.Description: Well organized and easy to understand Web building tutorials with lots of examples of how to use HTML, CSS, JavaScript, SQL, Python, PHP, Bootstrap, Java, XML and more.
metadata.og:description: W3Schools offers free online tutorials, references and exercises in all the major languages of the web. Covering popular subjects like HTML, CSS, JavaScript, Python, SQL, Java, and many, many more.

content.text: D3.js is a JavaScript library for manipulating HTML data.
content.html: D3.js is a JavaScript library for manipulating HTML data.

content.text: To use D3.js in your web page, add a link to the library:
content.html: To use D3.js in your web page, add a link to the library:

content.code_html: <script src="//d3js.org/d3.v3.min.js"></script>

content.text: This script selects the body element and appends a paragraph with the text "Hello World!":
content.html: This script selects the body element and appends a paragraph with the text "Hello World!":

content.code_html: d3.select("body").append("p").text("Hello World!");

syntaxHighlighting.text: // Append SVG Object to the Page

syntax_highlighting.text: // Append SVG Object to the Page

content.code_html:
// Set Dimensions
 const xSize = 500;
const ySize = 500;
const margin = 40;
const xMax = xSize - margin*2;
const yMax = ySize - margin*2;

// Create Random Points
 const numPoints = 100;
const data = [];
for (let i = 0; i < numPoints; i++) {
  data.push([Math.random() * xMax, Math.random() * yMax]);
}

// Append SVG Object to the Page
 const svg = d3.select("#myPlot")
  .append("svg")
  .append("g")
  .attr("transform","translate(" + margin + "," + margin + ")");

// X Axis
 const x = d3.scaleLinear()
  .domain([0, 500])
  .range([0, xMax]);

svg.append("g")
  .attr("transform", "translate(0," + yMax + ")")
  .call(d3.axisBottom(x));

// Y Axis
 const y = d3.scaleLinear()
  .domain([0, 500])
  .range([ yMax, 0]);

svg.append("g")
  .call(d3.axisLeft(y));

// Dots
 svg.append('g')
  .selectAll("dot")
  .data(data).enter()
  .append("circle")
  .attr("cx", function (d) { return d[0] } )
  .attr("cy", function (d) { return d[1] } )
  .attr("r", 3)
  .style("fill", "Red");

syntax_highlighting_data.text: // Append SVG Object to the Page
